src: nɯʑɤ-nɯ-raʁ ɯ́-ra
trs: Do you need liquor?' (elicited)

src: aʑo ɣɯ a-<laojia> ɣɯ ɯ-lɤcu nɯre ri ku-rɤʑi-nɯ ŋu
trs: They live in a place upstream from my old house.' (14-siblings, 238)

src: a-ɣɲi ci tɯ\redp{}tɯ-ŋu nɤ, a-mbro ɯ-lwa ɯ-taʁ kɤ-zo, a-ʁgra ci tɯ\redp{}tɯ-ŋu nɤ, a-mbro ɯ-jme ɯ-taʁ kɤ-zo
trs: If you are my friend, land on my horse's mane, if you are my enemy, land on my horse's tail.' (2002 qaCpa, 196)

src: aʑo a-mbro nɤrwɯrɯnbotɕʰi ŋu, tɯ-sŋi χpaχtsʰɤt ci ɲɯ́-wɣ-tsɯm-a cʰa
trs: My horse is Norbu Rinpoche, he can make me cross one yojana per day.' (2003smanmi2, 54)

src: iʑo a-mu nɯ tʰamtʰam kɯrcɤsqaptɯɣ tʰɯ-azɣɯt ŋu.
trs: My mother is now 81.' (2010-histoire09-2, 15)

src: tɕi-tɕɯ ɲɯ-sɤzdɯxpa,
trs: Our poor son!' (150831 renshen wawa-zh, 17)

imtwordshtml: ifr-peg-recip-caus-recip-hear-pl
src: tɤ-tɕɯ nɯ kɯ ɯ-zda tɯ-rdoʁ ɯ-pʰe to-ti, tɯ-rdoʁ nɯ kɯ li ci ɯ-pʰe tɕe ɲɤ-k-ɤ-sɯ-ɤmɯ-mtsʰɯ\redp{}mtsʰɤm-nɯ
trs: The boy told one of his companions, and that one another one, and (in this way) they informed each other.' (2012Norbzang, 82)

src: ɯ-rʑaβ nɯ kɯ na-βde
trs: His$_i$ wife left him$_i$.' (14-siblings, 289)

src: ɯ-rʑaβ cʰo ɯ-tɕɯ nɯ ʁnaʁna kɯ nɯ́-wɣ-βde
trs: His$_i$ wife and his$_i$ son left him$_i$.' (14-siblings, 294)

src: a-mbro taʁndo kɯ-tso ci tɕi ra
trs: I also need a horse who understands speech.' (2003kAndzwsqhaj2, 52)

src: aʑɯɣ a-kɯ-ra ci tu tɕe nɯ `ɣa' tɤ-ti ra
trs: There is one thing I need, and you have to say `yes' to it.' (140429 qingwa wangzi-zh, 47)

src: aʑɯɣ kɯ-ra me
trs: I don't need anything.' (2005 Norbzang, 275)

src: aʑɯɣ ɯ-lu ra
trs: I want its milk.' (02-deluge2012, 12)

src: tɯrme kɯ-mbro ra nɯ-fsu jamar tu-zɣɯt ma mɤ-cha
trs: It can only grow about as high as a tall human.' (15-babW, 4)

src: ɯ-tɯciste cʰɤ-ndʑɣaʁ
trs: Her waters have broken.' (elicited)

src: tɤ-rpɯ cʰo tɤ-ftsa ni ci kú-wɣ-pa mɤ-kɯ-kʰɯ ɲɯ-ŋu.
trs: Maternal uncles and sister's children cannot marry each other.'  (140427 kWmdza stWnmW, 14)

src: praʁkʰaŋ  zɯ tɤ-mu ci ɯ-ku tɤ-kɯ-wɣrum ci zɯŋzɯŋ pjɤ-rɤʑi tɕe,
trs: In the cave, there was an old woman whose hair was completely white.' (2003sras, 69)

src: tɕe nɯ tɤtsoʁsta nɯnɯ kʰɤɴqra ɕti tʰam tɕe kɯ-rɤʑi me
trs: Now Tatsogsta (`the place of silverweed') is a house in ruins, nobody lives there.' (140522 tshupa, 56)

src: wo nɯnɯ, ɣzɯ kɯ-xtɕɯ\redp{}xtɕi ci ɯ-pɯ ci ɲɯ-ɕti
trs: Oh, this is (just) a little monkey.' (18-04-28 xiyouji01-zh, 66)

src: ɯ-pa ɲɯ-kɯ-ɕe nɯ tɕe kɯmaʁ tɯrme, ɯ-xso tɯrme ra nɯ-tɕʰaʁra pjɤ-ŋu
trs: The toilets for other people, for normal people (not lamas), were on the (balcony) facing west under it.' (08-kWqhi, 10)

src: nɤʑo tɯrme ɯ-xso tɯ-maʁ
trs: You are not a normal human.' (150829 taishan zhi zhu-zh, 40)

src: ɯ-xso ku-rɤʑi tɕe,  ɯ-βri nɯnɯ scoʁ-pɯ pɯ-kɤ-βʁum ʑo fse
trs: (The ladybug) usually stays (in one place), its body looks like a little laddle put upside down.' (26-kWlAGpopo, 3)

src: toʁde tɕe tɕendɤre, nɯ-xso cʰɤ-nɯ-ɬoʁ-nɯ.
trs: A moment later, they came out empty-handed.' (140512 alibaba-zh, 34)

src: tsuku kɯ paʁndza ɲɯ-nɯ-pʰɯt-nɯ ɲɯ-ŋu ri, paʁ ra nɯ-scawa ma mɤ-mɯm ma ɯ-tɯ-qiaβ saχaʁ ʑo.
trs: Some people use it (\textit{Sambucus}) as hogwash, poor pigs, it is so bitter.' (12-ndZiNgri, 30-31)

src: wo tɯ-scawa, ku-tɯ-tso mɯ-pɯ-ra
trs: Alas and woe, you should not have known that.' (2012 Norbzang, 166)

src: ɕɯ ɣɯ ŋu kɯ, nɯ-kʰi ɣe!
trs: Whose are these, how lucky they are!' (2003 Kunbzang, 220)

src: a-kʰi ɲɯ-ŋgɯ
trs: I am lucky.' (140425 shizi puluomixiusi he daxiang-zh, 41)

src: tɕe ɯ-tɤ-lu pjɯ́-wɣ-rku tɕe nɯnɯ pjɯ-tsʰi qʰe,
trs: People pour milk for it (the cat) to drink, and it drinks it.' (21-lWLU, 47)

src: ci nɯ tɤ-tɕɯ nɯ χawo, nɯnɯ aʑo a-tɯrme nɯ a-pɯ-ŋu ndɤre, nɯ ɯ-tɯ-pe nɯ
trs: That boy, if only he could be my man, it would be so nice.' (2014-kWlAG, 418)

src: ɯ-ndzɯ mɤ-kɯ-sɤŋo ɯ-mɯ mbɯt
trs: Those who do not listen to advice from other people do not end well (their sky falls).' (elicited)

src: koŋla ɯ-stu ʑo a-pɯ-tɯ-rɤ-βzjoz, <zuoye> a-pɯ-tɯ-βze,
trs: Study seriously, do your homework.' (conversation 140501, 86)

src: nɤʑo nɤ-stu ʑo ɯ-ɲɯ-kɯ-nɯ-rga-a nɤ,
trs: If you really love me,...' (150907 yingning-zh, 147)

src: iɕqʰa nɤ-zda nɯ pɯ-sat-a ŋu tɕe, tʰam tɕe nɤʑo nɤ-βra pjɯ-ta-sat ra
trs: I just killed your companion, now it's your turn.' (elicited)

src: nɤj nɤ-βra tɤ-ndze
trs: It is your turn to eat.' (elicited)

src: nɤʑɯɣ a-pɤro tɕʰi ju-ɣɯt-a ra?
trs: What present should I bring for you?' (140504 huiguniang-zh, 28)

src: nɤʑo dɯxpa pɯ-tɯ-tu ma li nɤ-pɤro jɤ-tɯ-ɣɯt!
trs: Thank you, you brought another present (for me).' (elicited)

src: kɯki nɤ-rkuz ŋu
trs: This is a parting present for you.' (28-smAnmi, 266)

src: a-tɕɯ kɯ a-tɕʰa mɯ-na-kʰo.
trs: I have not heard from my son (My son did not give me any response).

src: nɤ-mu ɣɯ tʰɯci tu-rke-a tɕe ju-tɯ-tsɯm tɕe nɯnɯ nɤ-mu ɣɯ ɯ-skɯrma ju-sɯ-ɣɯt-a ŋu nɤ-mu kɯ a-tɤ-rke tɕe, a-jɤ-tɯ-ɣɯt tɕe, tɕe nɯnɯ li a-skɯrma jɤ-kɤ-sɯ-ɣɯt ŋu
trs: When I prepare something for your mother and you take it to her, (I can say) `I sent a present to you mother', if your mother prepares something and you bring it (to me), it is `a present sent to me.'' (def-skWrma, 18-19)

src: tɕe  	aʁɤndɯndɤt  	ʑo  	ku-zo  	qhe  	ɯ-qe  	ku-lɤt  	qʰe	wuma  ʑo  	tɯ-kʰa  	cʰo  	tɯ-laχtɕʰa  	ra  	sɯ-ɴqʰi.
trs: (Flies) land everywhere, shit and make one's houses and things dirty.' (25 akWzgumba, 59)

src: nɯ 	kɯ-fse 	tɕe 	tɯʑo 	tɯ-rɟit 	kɯnɤ 	ʑa 	mɤ-sci 	tu-ti-nɯ
trs: People say that in this way, one's child will be born late.' (27 qartshaz, 111)

src: tɯ-rpɯ 	ɯ-rɟit 	ɯ-ɕki 	tɕe 	tɕe 	``a-rpɯ a-ɬaʁ" 	tu-kɯ-ti 	ŋu.
trs: One has to say `my maternal uncle, my maternal aunt to one's maternal uncle's sons and daughters.' (140425 kWmdza01, 69)

src: tɯʑo sɤz kɯ-mna, kɯ-ɤʑɯχtso ra a-pɯ-ŋu nɤ,  tɯʑo tɯ-mtɕʰi maŋtaʁ nɯtɕu ɲɯ-ɬoʁ ŋu.
trs: If (one uses the bowl of) someone who is cleaner than oneself, the (pimple) will appear on one's upper lip.' (25-khArWm, 11)

src: tɯrme ɣɯ tɯ-ɕa ɯ-mdoʁ tsa asɯ-ndo kɯ-fse
trs: It has a little the colour of human flesh.' (14-sWNgWJu, 97)

src: ma tɯ-ɕki wuma ʑo ʑɣɤ-sɯ-ɤrmbat tɕe núndʐa kʰe tu-ti-nɯ ɲɯ-ŋu.
trs: It comes near humans a lot, so people call it `stupid'.' (23-scuz, 62)

src: χsɤr tɤ-sno tʰa-nɯ-ta ɲɯ-ŋu,
trs: He harnessed the golden saddle (on the horse).' (2003qachga, 111)

src: a-rte, a-χsɤr tɤ-rte ra kɯnɤ nɤʑɯɣ ɲɯ-kʰam-a jɤɣ
trs: I will even give you my hat, my golden hat.' (140429 qingwa wangzi-zh, 54)

src: nɤ-χsɤr kʰɯtsa nɯra ku-kɯ-sɯ-ntɕʰoz-a
trs: Let me use your golden bowl.' (140429 qingwa wangzi-zh, 135)

src: nɯnɯ a-kɯmtɕʰɯ, χsɤr a-kɯmtɕʰɯ nɯnɯ kɤ-ɣɯt a-pɯ-tɯ-cʰa qʰe,
trs: If you can bring my toy, my golden toy back...' (140429 qingwa wangzi-zh, 52)

src: iʑora ji-pʰe kɤmɲɯ nɯtɕu <xiaoxue> <yinianji> <ernianji> pɯ-ndɯn-a.
trs: I studied the first and second grade of primary school at our place in Kamnyu.' (140501 tshering skyid, 12)

src: a-wa nɯnɯ kupa ŋu
trs: My father is Chinese.' (140501 tshering skyid, 4)

src: tɕe ʁnɯ-tɯpɯ nɯnɯ taʁrdo ŋu
trs: These two households are Taqrdo.

src: a-pi kɯ tɤ́-wɣ-ndo-a tɕe tɕe, mbarkʰom tʰɯ́-wɣ-ɣɯt-a,
trs: My elder brother brought me to Mbarkham.' (140501 tshering skyid, 28)

imt: \textsc{lnk} \textsc{indef}.\textsc{poss}-weather release:\textsc{fact} at.the.time \textsc{lnk} placename \textsc{3sg}.\textsc{poss}-direction \textsc{loc} \textsc{ipfv}:\textsc{west}-\textsc{genr}:S/O-look \textsc{lnk} cloud \textsc{indef} \textsc{ipfv}:\textsc{up}-\textsc{auto}-come.out be:\textsc{fact} now also cloud \textsc{ipfv}:\textsc{up}-\textsc{auto}-come.out be:\textsc{fact} \textsc{lnk} \textsc{dem} at.all placename \textsc{erg} cloud \textsc{ifr}-take.out \textsc{pl} \textsc{ipfv}-say-\textsc{pl}
src: tɕe tɯ-mɯ lɤt tɤkha tɕe, qaprɤŋar ɯ-stu ri ɲɯ-kɯ-ru tɕe zdɯm ci tu-nɯ-ɬoʁ ŋu. tʰam kɯnɤ zdɯm tu-nɯ-ɬoʁ ŋu tɕe, nɯ maka qaprɤŋar kɯ zdɯm to-tɕɤt ra tu-ti-nɯ
trs: And when it is about to rain, when one looks towards Qaprangar, a cloud comes out from it. Even now a cloud comes out, and (the elders) say `Qaprangar released a cloud.''  (140522 Kamnyu zgo, 328-330)

src: nɯ-me tɯlɤt nɯ ɲɤ-mbi-nɯ
trs: They gave him their second daughter.' (2002 qaCpa, 40)

src: kɯ-lɤɣ acɤβ nɯ kɯ, ɯ-pʰɯŋgɯ nɯtɕu qapɯtɯm ci na-rku ɲɯ-ŋu,
trs: The shepherd Askyabs put a pebble in the folds of his clothes (to avoid forgetting what he had to told the king).'  (Kunbzang 332)

src: tɕe χpɯn ɯ-rmi nɯ, aʑo a-rmi nɯ stɤnbiɲima tɤ́-wɣ-sɤrmi-a-nɯ.
trs: They gave me the name Bstanpa'i nyima as my monk name.' (160721 XpWN, 38)

src: zrɤntɕɯ tɯrme ci pjɤ-tu, tɯpɕi kɯ-rmi ci pjɤ-tu, tɯrme nɯ-rmi ɲɯ-ŋu nɤ
trs: There was (a lady) was was called `Mung bean', and (another one) called `Flax', these are names of people.' (zrAntCW, 1)

src: a-nmaʁ χpɤltɕin
trs: My husband Dpalcan.' (heard in context)

src: ka?
trs: (Tshering Sgrolma): `What?

src: χpɤltɕin ɯ-kʰa nɯ taʁrdo rmi tɕe taʁrdo χpɤltɕin tu-kɯ-ti.
trs: Dpalcan's house is called Taqrdo, so one (can) call him `Taqrdo Dpalcan'.' (elicited)

src: tɕendɤre 	iɕqʰa 	ʁlaŋsaŋtɕʰin 	χsɯm 	ma 	mɯ-tɤ-kɯ-rʑaʁ 	nɯ,
trs: Gesar, who was only three days old,'  (Gesar 81)

src: nɯ ɕɯŋgɯ ɯ-nmaʁ pɯ-kɯ-ŋu tsʰɯraŋ nɯ pjɤ-mto
trs: See saw Tshering, who had been her husband before.' (2002qajdoskAt,

src: tsʰi tɤ-mda tɕe nɯ ɯʑo ɯ-cʰɤmdɤru nɯ pjɯ-nɯ-rʁe tɕe pjɯ-nɯ-tsʰi, mɯ-na-tsʰi tɕe tɕe li tu-nɯ-χɕoʁ tɕe ɯ-mtʰɤrɴɢɤβ cʰɯ-nɯ-rʁe
trs: When it is time to drink, he inserts his straw (into the jar) and drinks from it, and when he does not drink any more, he takes it out and tucks it back into his trousers.' (30-tChorzi, 45)

src: ɯ-taʁ ɯ-mnɯ kɯnɤ kɯ-zri tu-ɬoʁ mɯ́j-cʰa tɕe, nɯ-kɤ-ʁndzɤr ʑo ɲɯ-fse tɕe nɯ ʑmbrɯkɤlu tu-kɯ-ti ŋu. tɕe nɯ ɯ-ku kɯ-me kɤ-ti ɲɯ-ŋu.  kɤlu nɯ ɯ-ku kɯ-me kɤ-ti ɲɯ-ŋu.
trs: Its new twigs cannot grow very long, and look like they have been sawed short, therefore it is called `headless willow'. `Headless' means `without head'.' (07-Zmbri, 34-36)

imt: \textsc{lnk} \textsc{dem} Euphorbia.helioscopia \textsc{dem} poisonous:\textsc{fact} \textsc{3sg}.\textsc{poss}-milk exist:\textsc{fact} \textsc{lnk}  \textsc{indef}.\textsc{poss}-milk \textsc{sbj}:\textsc{pcp}-be.like \textsc{sbj}:\textsc{pcp}-\textsc{emph}\redp{}be.white be:\textsc{fact} completely \textsc{emph} \textsc{ipfv}-\textsc{inv}-break \textsc{lnk} there \textsc{3sg}.\textsc{poss}-milk exist:\textsc{fact}
src: tɕe nɯ kʰɯlu nɯnɯ sɤndɤɣ. ɯ-lu tu tɕe, tɤ-lu kɯ-fse kɯ-wɣrɯ\redp{}wɣrum ŋu. koŋla ʑo, pjɯ́-wɣ-qlɯt tɕe, nɯre ɯ-lu tu.
trs: The \textit{Euphorbia helioscopia} is toxic, it has a juice white like milk, when it is broken, there is milk in (the stalk). (19-khWlu, 20-22)

src: βʁɤnŋo maŋe-ndʑi
trs: One cannot decide who (of the two of them) is winning and who is losing.

src: kɯ-xtɕi nɯ ɣɯ pjɤ-me tɕe, tɕendɤre rca kɯzɣɤ-ɕar ʑo ɲɤ-βzu-nɯ ri pjɤ-me.
trs: The (pigeon skin) of the youngest girl was not there, there looked for it for a long time but it was not there.' (the flood 2002, 55)

imt: \textit{Lonicera} \textsc{3sg}.\textsc{poss}-name \textsc{dem}:\textsc{prox:pl} \textsc{dem} \textsc{lnk} \textsc{3sg}.\textsc{poss}-skin \textsc{sbj}:\textsc{pcp}-\textsc{emph}\redp{}be.many \textsc{emph} \textsc{ipfv}-\textsc{acaus}:peel \textsc{sens}-be \textsc{dem} one-leaf \textsc{lnk}  one-leaf  one-leaf \textsc{lnk}  one-leaf \textsc{aor}-\textsc{acaus}:peel \textsc{lnk} \textsc{3sg}.\textsc{poss}-inside again yet \textsc{ipfv}-grow \textsc{lnk}
src: kɯngɯttɤrqʰɤɴɢaʁ ɯ-rmi kɯra nɯnɯ tɕendɤre, ɯ-rqʰu kɯ-dɯ\redp{}dɤn ʑo pjɯ-ɴɢaʁ ɲɯ-ŋu. nɯnɯ tɯ-mpɕar nɤ tɯ-mpɕar, tɯ-mpɕar nɤ tɯ-mpɕar, pɯ-ɴɢaʁ qʰe ɯ-ŋgɯ li mɤʑɯ ɲɯ-βze qʰe,
trs: As for the name of the \textit{Lonicera} sp., (it is because) it has a lot of skins that shed off, one after the other, and after one has shed off, another one grows again inside.' (14-sWNgWJu, 72-5)

src: nɯ ɯ-taʁ ri zrɯɣndza kɤ-ndo-tɕi tɕe, .... tɕendɤre zrɯɣ rcanɯ lɤŋɤtʂɤɣ jamar ʑo ɯ-ɕki kɤ-ta-tɕi. tɕe kɯ-mɤku nɯra tɕe, tɕe zrɯɣ nɯ lonba ʑo cʰɯ-mqlaʁ tɕe tu-ndze ɲɯ-ŋu. tɕendɤre kɯ-maqʰu tɕe nɤki ɲɯ-ŋu,  tɕendɤre ku-nɯni kɯ-fse qhe, ɯ-ŋgɯ nɯnɯ,  ɯ-se nɯ lu-nɯ-tɕɤt qʰe cʰɯ-mqlaʁ ɲɯ-ŋu.
trs: (When we were little, one of my classmate had a lot of lice, and) we took a praying mantis (and put it on his clothes), then put five or six lice near it; the first ones, it swallowed them whole, and the following ones,  it did the following: it would kind of suck them, drink the blood inside them, and then swallow it (and then throw them away).' (26-zrWGndza, 25-35)

imt: burdock \textsc{lnk} who \textsc{erg}  \textsc{aor}:3\flobv{}-see \textsc{dem} \textsc{lnk} \textsc{lnk} \textsc{dem} \textsc{gen} \textsc{3sg}:\textsc{gen} not.be:\textsc{fact} \textsc{lnk} \textsc{3sg}.\textsc{poss}-house \textsc{gen} not.be:\textsc{fact} \textsc{lnk}  \textsc{3sg}.\textsc{poss}-relative \textsc{sbj}:\textsc{pcp}-be.like \textsc{pl} \textsc{gen} \textsc{3pl}.\textsc{poss}-son not.be:\textsc{fact} \textsc{lnk} \textsc{3pl}.\textsc{poss}-daughter exist:\textsc{fact} \textsc{ipfv}-say-\textsc{pl} \textsc{sens}-be \textsc{lnk} \textsc{dem} \textsc{3pl}.\textsc{poss}-relative  \textsc{sbj}:\textsc{pcp}-be.like  \textsc{sbj}:\textsc{pcp}-be.related \textsc{pl}  \textsc{3pl}.\textsc{poss}-body  \textsc{neg}-\textsc{sbj}:\textsc{pcp}-be.well \textsc{irr}-\textsc{ipfv}-exist \textsc{lnk} \textsc{interj} .... \textsc{3sg}.\textsc{poss}-child \textsc{indef}.\textsc{poss}-son \textsc{lnk} be.born:\textsc{fact} burdock \textsc{aor}-see-\textsc{tr}:\textsc{pst}-\textsc{1sg}
src: tɤtɕɯβraʁ tɕe, ɕɯ kɯ pa-mto nɯnɯ tɕe tɕe nɯ ɣɯ ɯʑɤɣ maʁ nɤ, ɯ-kʰa ɣɯ maʁ nɤ,  ɯ-kɯmdza kɯ-fse ra ɣɯ, nɯ-tɕɯ maʁ nɤ nɯ-me tu tu-ti-nɯ ɲɯ-ŋu. tɕe nɯ nɯ-kɯmdza kɯ-fse kɯ-ɤrɕɤt ra, nɯ-skʰrɯ mɤ-kɯ-βdi a-pɯ-tu tɕe, ``wo ... ɯ-rɟit tɤ-tɕɯ sci ma tɤtɕɯβraʁ pɯ-mto-t-a"
trs: The burdock, whoever saw it will have a boy or a girl, him or someone from his house or among his relatives. If someone among his relatives is pregnant, he will say `her child will be a boy, as I saw a burdock.'' (26-NalitCaRmbWm, 109+)

src: nɯnɯ kɯ-mɤɕi kɯnɤ kɯ-rɤ-ɕtʂat nɯ, qandʐe tʰɤlwɤ-ɕtʂat tu-ti-nɯ.
trs: Someone who spares things (does not waste anything) even though he is rich, people call him an `earth-sparing earthworm'.' (25-akWzgumba, 136-137)

src: maka ɲɯ́-wɣ-ɕɯɣ-mu mɯ-pjɤ-cʰa ma mɯ-pjɤ-mtsʰɤm matɕi ɯ-rna pjɤ-k-ɤ-sti-ci.
trs: The noise could not frighten him, as he did not hear it, because his ears were blocked.' (140514 huishuohua de niao-zh, 203)

src: mbala kɯ tɤ́-wɣ-tɕʰɯ-a
trs: The bull gored me.' (elicited)

src: zgrɯtɕʰɯ tɤ-lat-a
trs: I nudged (him).' (elicited)

src: sɤŋaβ-di ʑo ɲɯ-mnɤm
trs: There is an unpleasant smell.' (elicited)

src: tɕe ndzɤpri kɤ-ti nɯ tɕe tɯrme tu-kɯ-ndza ɲɯ-ŋgrɤl
trs: It eats people, so is it called \forme{ndzɤpri}.' (21-pri, 94)

src: ʑɤni ɣɯ ftsoʁ ʁrɯlu ci ta-rku-nɯ ɲɯ-ŋu
trs: They gave them a hornless female yak (to take with them back to the husband's home.' (2005-stod, 243)

imt: \textsc{lnk} animal tailless \textsc{dem} man \textsc{sens}-be \textsc{3sg}.\textsc{poss}-tail \textsc{sbj}:\textsc{pcp}-not.exist \textsc{dem} \textsc{lnk} \textsc{lnk} animal tailless  \textsc{dem} \textsc{ipfv}-be.crazy  be:\textsc{aff}:\textsc{fact} \textsc{lnk} \textsc{dem} \textsc{aor}-be.crazy \textsc{lnk} \textsc{lnk} the.aforementioned \textsc{indef}.\textsc{poss}-seed \textsc{ipfv}-\textsc{sbj}:\textsc{pcp}-spread \textsc{dem} \textsc{aor}-\textsc{sbj}:\textsc{pcp}-be.crazy \textsc{ipfv}-call-\textsc{pl}
src: tɕe kɯju jmɤlu nɯnɯ tɯrme ɲɯ-ŋu, ɯ-jme kɯ-me nɯ tɕe, tɕe kɯju jmɤlu nɯnɯ ɲɯ-sɲu ɕti tɕe nɯ  nɯ-sɲu tɕe tɕe iɕqʰa tɯ-rɣi cʰɯ-kɯ-χtɤr nɯ nɯ-kɯ-sɲu tu-sɤrmi-nɯ.
trs: The `tailless animal' is the man, and `he becomes crazy', (when the crow say) that (people) became crazy, it means that they are sowing seeds.' (22-qajdo, 47-9)

imt: just.before \textsc{dem} downstream de \textsc{dem}.\textsc{prox}  heddle downstream.one \textsc{dem}.\textsc{prox} \textsc{aor}-lift-\textsc{1sg} \textsc{pst}.\textsc{ipfv}-be \textsc{lnk} now \textsc{lnk} upstream.one \textsc{dem}.\textsc{pl} \textsc{ipfv}-\textsc{inv}-lift be.needed:\textsc{fact}
src: iɕqʰa nɯ, tʰi nɯ, kɯki ɕnat maŋtʰi ki tɤ-joʁ-a pɯ-ŋu tɕe,  tʰam tɕe maŋlo nɯra tú-wɣ-joʁ ra
trs: Just before, I had lifted the heddle on the lower (downstream) side (of the loom), now we have to lift the ones on the upper (upstream) side.' (video 20140429090403, 71-72)

src: tɕe srɯnloʁ-pɯ ci ɲɤ-kʰo tɕe
trs: He handed him a little ring.' (2011-4-smanmi, 120)

src: ɬɤndʐi-pɯ-pɯ nɯra kɯ, ɯ-pʰoŋbu nɯra ko-sɤlɤɣɯ-nɯ ri,
trs: The little demonlings put back his body together, but...' (150909 xifangping-zh, 93)

imt: stupid bird:\textsc{dim} on.the.other.hand male female be.clear:\textsc{fact}
src: tɤkʰe pɣɤtɕɯ ndɤre pʰu mu saχsɤl
trs: The male and the female of the `stupid bird', as opposed (to the birds previously discussed), are easy to distinguish.' (23-scuz, 45)

src: kɤndʑi-xtɤɣ χsɯm pjɤ-tu-nɯ
trs: There were three brothers.' (07-deluge, 1)

src: kɤndʑi-ftsɯ\redp{}ftsoʁ χsɯm nɯ, tsʰɯntsʰɯn kɯ-pa kɤ-nɯ-ɬoʁ-nɯ ɲɯ-ŋu,
trs: (The girl, her husband) and their female hybrid yak crossed (the large river) without damage.' (2003 Kunbzang, 186)

src: tɕe tɤ-mu nɯ kɯ ɯ-pɯ nɯnɯ ju-ɕpʰɣɤm tɕe, ʑara kɤtsa ra stɯsti ʁɟa ʑo ɕe-nɯ ɲɯ-ra.
trs: And the mother (lioness) flees with her cubs, and they (mother and children) have to go alone (without the father).' (20-sWNgi, 75)

src: tɤ-mu kɤtsa ci pjɤ-tu-ndʑi tɕe
trs: There was a mother and her son.' (2003 tamukatsa, 1)

src: a-χsɯ\redp{}χsɤr ra, a-rŋɯ\redp{}rŋɯl ra mɤ-ra kɯ ɕom rɟɤskɤt ɯ-taʁ tu-ɕe-a ŋu
trs: I don't need things in gold or silver, I will go up the iron stairs.' (not the golden or silver stairs, 2005-Kunbzang, 215)

src: znɤrɣama nɯ mtʰa ɯ-kɤcu ŋu. tɕe nɯnɯtɕu tɯ-ji ɯ-ntɕhantɕhɯr pɯ-dɤn, jinde kʰro ɲɤ-s-qapɯ-nɯ,
trs: Znargama ('The place where one calls the rain') is on the east of Mtha, there used to be many little fragments of fields, but now people have left them become fallow.' (150903 kAmYW tWji3, 19)

src: tɕe tɤɕi nɯ tú-wɣ-χtɕi tɕʰɣaʁtɕʰɣaʁ ʑo tɕe, rdardɯl nɯra ɲɯ́-wɣ-ɣɤ-me tɕe
trs: Then one washes the barley very thoroughly, one removes all the dirt.' (2002tWsqar, 118)

src: rgargɯn ni kɤ-fstɯn pɯ-ra
trs: She had to take care of two old people.' (14-siblings, 34)

src: rɟɤmtsʰu ɯ-qaɕɯqa pjɯ-ɕe tɕe, nɯnɯ ɯ-kɤ-nɤ-mɯm nɯra ɕ-tu-nɯ-tɕɤt ɲɯ-ŋu.
trs: (The sperm whale) goes to the lowest depths of the ocean and catches the things it likes to eat.' (160703 jingyu, 24)

src: ɯ-nmaʁ pɯ-kɯ-ŋu
trs: Her ex-husband (the one who used to be her husband).' (several attestations)

src: ɯ-tɯ-ɤɣɯ-mdzu saχaʁ
trs: It is very thorny (its degree of having thorns is extreme).' (18-NGolo, 75)

src: kɤɣɯ-rtɯ\tld{}rte 	ʑo 	kʰa	ɯ-ŋgɯ	lɤ-tɯ-ɣe
trs: You came inside the house wearing your hat.' (You were expected to take it off before coming in, elicited)

src: laχtɕʰa kɤɣɯ-tɤ-rtɯ\redp{}rte ʑo ta-ndo
trs: He took the hat along with the other objects.' (Not wearing it, elicited)

src: tʂʰa kɤ́-tɤ-lɯ\redp{}lu
trs: Milk tea.'  (30-Com, 94)

src: tɤ-sno kɤ́-jɯ\redp{}jaʁ nɯ lu-ta-nɯ
trs: (Then), they put the saddle with its handles.' (30-tAsno, 77)

src: lɯlu kɤ́-rɟɯ\tld{}rɟit ra kɯ ʑo βʑɯ to-ndza-nɯ.
trs: The cat and its young ate the mouse.' (elicited)

src: li βʑɯ kɤ́-mtɕʰɯ\redp{}mtɕʰi ci nɯ ɲɯ-fse
trs: (The bat's) mouth is like that of a mouse.' (literally `It looks like a mouse with its mouth.' 25-qarmWrwa, 12)

src: tɕe nɯ jlɤkrɯ ci kɤ́-rɯ\redp{}ri ci ɲɤ-rŋo,
trs: He borrowed a rake with a thread.' (140427 qala cho kWrtsAG, 60)

src: rɟɤlpu kɤɣɯ-ŋkhɯ\tld{}ŋkhor kɯ\tld{}kɯ-ŋɤn ʑo to-ndo tɕe, tɕendɤre kɯ-mɤku nɯ sɤtɕʰa kɯ\tld{}kɯ-sɤ-scit ʑo jo-tsɯm ɲɯ-ŋu ri kɯ-maqʰu tɕe, kɯ\tld{}kɯ-sɤɣ-mu ʑo jo-tsɯm tɕe
trs: She took the king and his subjects, all the evil ones, in the beginning she took them to nice places, but later she took them to fearful places.' (2012 Norbzang, 390)

src: cʰa ra tʂɯ\redp{}tʂu kú-wɣ-nɯ-tsʰi tɕe
trs: One drinks alcohol along the way (back home).' (2010-histoire10)
